excerpt: This 18th-century Kerala-style palace features a serpent grove & a museum with sculptures & coins.
detail_description: Sakthan Thampuran Palace, an 18th-century Kerala-style architectural marvel located in the heart of Thrissur, has been transformed into a museum showcasing historical artifacts. The palace boasts a unique blend of Dutch and traditional Kerala architecture, featuring high roofs, thick walls, spacious rooms, and Italian marble flooring. Visitors can explore the serpent grove on the premises and admire the museum's collection of sculptures and coins. This cultural heritage site offers a fascinating experience for history enthusiasts.
name: Sakthan Thampuran Palace
address: Stadium Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

excerpt: Established in 1885, this lush zoo has a range of animals & a museum on local natural history & art.
detail_description: Nestled in a lush 13.5-acre area, Thrissur Zoo & Museum is a historic establishment dating back to 1885. It features a diverse range of animals, birds, and reptiles, including endangered species. The zoo also houses an Art Museum, Botanical Garden, Natural History Museum, and Zoological Museum. Visitors can marvel at tigers, camels, hippos, flamingos, and various bird species while exploring this well-maintained space.
name: Thrissur Zoo & Museum
address: Town Hall Rd, Udaya Nagar, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

excerpt: Large, Gothic-style Catholic church built in 1929, offering masses several times a day.
detail_description: Our Lady of Dolours Basilica is a grand Gothic-style Catholic church constructed in 1929, and it hosts multiple masses daily. Located in Thrissur, Kerala, the basilica is part of a vibrant area with various attractions such as temples, waterfalls, wildlife sanctuaries, and cultural landmarks. The region also hosts the renowned Thrissur Pooram festival. Additionally, exploring nearby Fort Kochi offers a glimpse into its rich history influenced by Portuguese, Dutch, and British cultures.
name: Our Lady of Dolours Basilica
address: G6C9+C52, Erinjery Angady, Pallikkulam, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Ancient Shiva temple featuring legendary murals, shrines & an annual festival for devotees.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Thrissur, the Sree Vadakkumnathan Temple stands as a magnificent testament to Kerala's rich cultural heritage. This ancient temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, showcases stunning architectural features with monumental towers gracing each side and a Koothambalam that serves as a stage for traditional performances. The walls are adorned with exquisite murals that narrate tales from the Mahabharata, captivating visitors with their intricate artistry.
name: Sree Vadakkumnathan Temple
address: Swaraj Round N, Kuruppam, Thekkinkadu Maidan, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Imposing Hindu complex where the goddess Durga is said to have traveled on a believer's umbrella.
detail_description: Paramekkavu Bhagavathi Temple in Thrissur is a significant Hindu complex where the goddess Durga is believed to have traveled on a believer's umbrella. It is one of the largest temples dedicated to Bhagavathy in Kerala and is known for its captivating architectural design. The temple plays a crucial role in the vibrant Thrissur Pooram festival, adding to the city's festive spirit with its annual rituals and ceremonies that draw devotees and tourists alike.
name: Paramekkavu Bhagavathi Temple Thrissur
address: Paramekkavu Devaswom Building, Round East, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

detail_description: Vilangan kunnu is one of the important places to visit in Thrissur, Kerala.
name: Vilangan kunnu
address: Vilangan hills ticket counter, Puranattukara, Kerala 680553, India

excerpt: Leafy hilltop park for walks, cycling & sunset views, with kids' play equipment & a snack bar.
detail_description: Vilangan Hills, also known as Vilangan Kunnu, is a picturesque hilltop park located near Trissur in Kerala. This green hillock offers stunning panoramic views of Thrissur city and the kole wetlands. Originally a common hillock, it was transformed into a scenic picnic spot under the eco-tourism scheme by the State Government of Kerala. The park features 150 mango trees and provides an enchanting allure to visitors.
name: Vilangan Hills
address: H549+XC4, Vilagan Hill Road, Thrissur, 680553, India

detail_description: The Thrissur Pooram Kudamattam Ground is the vibrant setting for a colorful festival celebrated at Vadakkumnathan temple in April. The temple, located on a hillock at the city's center, draws thousands of devotees. Founded by Sakthan Thampuran, the ruler of Kochi, this festival is known as the People's Festival and is a source of pride for all Thrissur residents.
name: Thrissur Pooram Kudamattam Ground
address: G6F7+9WJ, Pradakshina Path, Kuruppam, Thekkinkadu Maidan, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: This 8.5-acre landscaped children's park features flowers, hedges, statues & an aquarium.
detail_description: Nehru Park, also known as Heritage Garden, is an 8.5-acre landscaped park located in the heart of Thrissur. Named after India's first prime minister, it is a popular attraction for both tourists and locals. The park boasts a vast collection of ayurvedic and medicinal plants, making it a serene and educational experience. Visitors can enjoy the beauty of flowers, hedges, statues, an aquarium, and various recreational facilities for children.
name: Nehru Park, Thrissur
address: G6G8+M8Q, Swaraj Round N, Kuruppam, Thekkinkadu Maidan, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

detail_description: Cheppara, located in Thrissur, is a hidden culinary gem offering a wide range of delectable dishes, from traditional Kerala delicacies to innovative fusion creations. The place features beautiful landscapes and requires climbing a hill with banister support. It's not recommended for children or the elderly, especially during the slippery monsoon season.
name: Cheppara
address: Kerala, India

detail_description: The Heritage Garden in Thrissur is a beloved spot in the heart of the city, attracting visitors with its well-maintained grounds and diverse flora. This tranquil oasis showcases Kerala's rich biodiversity and cultural history through its indigenous plant and animal species. It's an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts, offering a peaceful atmosphere for leisurely walks among forest and medicinal trees.
name: Heritage Garden
address: G6H8+XHF, Unnamed Road, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: The Archaeological Museum, located in the Thrissur Zoo complex, has a rich history dating back to its establishment in 1938. Originally a picture gallery, it was later converted into an archaeology museum in 1975. The museum boasts life-size statues of prominent personalities, models of ancient temples and monuments, as well as a collection of manuscripts written on dry palm leaves. Visitors can also explore artifacts from various archaeological sites including those from the Indus Valley Civilization and Harappa.
name: Archaeological Museum, Thrissur
address: G6J8+FHM, Stadium Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: The Arattupuzha Sree Sastha Temple, located in Thrissur, Kerala, is a place of great cultural and religious importance. Dedicated to Lord Ayyappa, this ancient temple has a history dating back over 3,000 years. It was originally a Dravidian temple before becoming a prominent Buddhist site and eventually transitioning into Hindu hands in the 8th century.
name: Arattupuzha Sree Sastha Temple
address: C69H+9X5, P.O. Arattupuzha, Urakam, (Dt), Kerala (State), Arattupuzha, Kerala 680562, India

name: Kerala Sahitya Academy Hall Thrissur
address: Town Hall Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680005, India

detail_description: The Archaeological Museum, പുരാവസ്തു മ്യൂസിയം in Thrissur town is a treasure trove of artifacts that offer insights into Kerala's rich history. The museum boasts diverse galleries showcasing mural paintings, wood carvings, and ethnographic objects from different periods. Visitors can explore pre-cultural artifacts that provide glimpses into early human settlements in the region.
name: Archaeological Museum, Sakthan Thampuran Palace
address: Vadakke Stand, Bus Stop, Karunakaran Nambiar Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

excerpt: This Kerala-style Hindu temple participates in the Thrissur Pooram, featuring an elephant procession.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Thrissur city, the Thiruvambady SreeKrishna Temple is a stunning example of traditional Kerala architecture. Renowned for its intricate wooden carvings and sloping roofs, this temple is not just a place of worship but also a cultural hub that plays a pivotal role in the annual Thrissur Pooram festival. This grand celebration features lively elephant processions and colorful performances, drawing thousands of devotees and tourists alike.
name: Thiruvambady SreeKrishna Temple
address: Railway Gate, Thiruvambady, Punkunnam, Thrissur, Kerala 680022, India

detail_description: The Bible Tower in Thrissur, a stunning 260-foot structure completed in 2007, is an architectural marvel that stands as the tallest church tower in Asia. Nestled within the Puthenpalli premises, this impressive tower features intricate frescoes depicting scenes of crucifixion and other biblical narratives. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of Thrissur from its top floors, although access to the very top is limited.
name: Bible Tower Thrissur
address: G6C9+9CQ, Erinjeri Angadi, Latin Church Rd, Erinjeri, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Sizable complex of stores, with a supermarket, international food court & 6-screen multiplex cinema.
detail_description: Sobha City Mall is a sprawling shopping complex located in Thrissur, Kerala. Situated along the Guruvayur Road, it has become a popular destination for locals and tourists alike. The mall boasts an extensive range of retail stores featuring both national and international brands, making it a go-to spot for all kinds of shoppers. In addition to shopping, visitors can enjoy various entertainment options such as a 6-screen multiplex cinema, restaurants, food court, and gaming arcade.
name: Sobha City Mall
address: Sobha city, Puzhakkal, Thrissur, Kerala 680553, India

excerpt: Landmark Catholic church featuring ornate neo-Gothic architecture & an intimate underground shrine.
detail_description: The Lady of Lourdes Metropolitan Cathedral in Thrissur is a significant Catholic church known for its stunning neo-Gothic architecture and an underground shrine. It also serves as the diocese building and features a smaller chapel below ground level, which is a popular tourist attraction. The cathedral, located on the Thrissur-Palakkad road to the east of town, boasts an impressive gopuram tower with Indo-European aesthetics.
name: Our Lady of Lourdes Metropolitan Cathedral
address: G6FH+63W, East Fort, Kizhakkumpattukara, Thrissur, Kerala 680005, India

name: Thrissur Town Hall (K. Karunakaran Memorial Town Hall)
address: Palace Rd, opposite Taluk Office, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

excerpt: Kuriachira is a municipal ward in Thrissur, Kerala. It is located within 2 km south of Swaraj Round. It lies beside the Thalore bypass road. Kuriachira is 25th division of Thrissur Municipal Corporation. It is an important residential area of Thrissur city of Kerala state of India. Wikipedia.
name: Kuriachira
address: Thrissur, Kerala, India

excerpt: Compact Thekkinkadu Maidan is centered on hilltop Sri Vadakkunnathan Temple, decorated with traditional Keralan wood carvings and murals of the Hindu epic “Mahabharata.” The temple is the hub of spring’s huge Thrissur Pooram festival, which features fireworks, drumming, and a parade of costumed elephants. Nehru Park has playgrounds and an aquarium, and simple Indian restaurants are scattered throughout the area.
detail_description: The Thekkinkadu Maidan is a vibrant and lively area centered around the hilltop Sri Vadakkunnathan Temple, adorned with traditional Keralan wood carvings and murals depicting scenes from the Hindu epic “Mahabharata.” This location serves as the focal point for the grand Thrissur Pooram festival, a 36-hour-long celebration featuring over 100 elephants, accompanied by Panchavadyam music and culminating in a spectacular fireworks display.
name: Thekkinkadu Maidan
address: Kuruppam, Thrissur, Kerala, India

excerpt: Founded in 1958, a local theatre championing Keralan folk performances, plays, music and dance.
name: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi
address: Regional Theater Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

excerpt: Artifacts, photos & high-tech displays exploring the history of the Ayurvedic medical system.
detail_description: Vaidyaratnam Ayurveda Museum in Kerala is a unique showcase of the history and evolution of Ayurveda, featuring artifacts, photos, and high-tech displays. The museum offers a detailed exploration of the merits and richness of Ayurvedic medicine through images, models, charts, and a panoramic exhibit tracing its history from ancient times to the modern era.
name: Vaidyaratnam Ayurveda Museum
address: Thaikkattussery Rd, opp. Vaidyaratnam Post Office, Thaikkattussery, Thrissur, Kerala 680306, India

excerpt: Thrissur is a city in the south Indian state of Kerala. It's known for sacred sites and colorful festivals. In the center is Vadakkumnathan Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and adorned with murals. The ornate, Indo-Gothic Our Lady of Dolours Basilica is nearby. To the north, Thiruvambady Temple is home to several elephants. Sakthan Thampuran Palace houses an archaeology museum with bronze statues and ancient coins.
detail_description: Thrissur, located in the southern state of Kerala, is a city renowned for its sacred sites and lively festivals. The Vadakkumnathan Temple at the heart of the city is dedicated to Lord Shiva and features stunning murals, while nearby stands the ornate Our Lady of Dolours Basilica. The Thiruvambady Temple to the north is home to several elephants, and the Sakthan Thampuran Palace houses an archaeology museum displaying bronze statues and ancient coins.
name: Thrissur
address: Kerala, India

detail_description: The Appan Thampuran Memorial, also known as Ramavarma Appanthampuran Smarakam, is a cultural and literary museum located in Ayyanthole, Kerala. It is housed within the historic Kumarapuram Palace and was established in 1976 to honor the contributions of Ramavarma Appan Thampuran to literature and culture. The museum boasts an impressive collection of journals, magazines, and books that offer visitors a captivating insight into Kerala's rich cultural and literary heritage.
name: Appan Thampuran Memorial
address: Outpost Rd, Kalyan Nagar, Ayyanthole, Thrissur, Kerala 680003, India

detail_description: Alibaba & 41 Dishes in Thrissur, located in Kuttanellur, is a popular restaurant known for its traditional biryani. The restaurant offers a wide range of flavorful dishes and is particularly famous for its biryanis cooked with fragrant spices and served with raita and salna. While the prices are on the higher side, the food is described as flavorful and wonderful by many visitors.
name: Alibaba & 41 Dishes - Thrissur
address: No 331, Ground Floor, Manappuram Building, Kuruppam Rd, Marar Road Area, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Fine arts center offering rotating exhibits, a public library & archives in a stately brick home.
detail_description: Kerala Lalithakala Akademi is a cultural institution that features changing displays of artwork, as well as a community library and historical records housed in an impressive brick mansion. This fine arts establishment provides visitors with the opportunity to view diverse exhibitions on a rotating basis while also offering access to public resources such as books and archives. The stately architecture of the building adds to the overall ambiance, making Kerala Lalithakala Akademi an ideal destination for anyone interested in art and culture.
name: Kerala Lalithakala Akademi
address: G6M9+478, Regional Theater Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: The impressive structure of the Town Hall in Thrissur is situated within an extensive area adorned with lawns and gardens. This renowned establishment appeals to art enthusiasts, particularly due to its 'chitralayam' or picture gallery, which showcases mural paintings from various regions of Kerala. The venue serves as a common ground for discussions, seminars, and book launches, exemplifying Thrissur's reputation as the cultural capital of Kerala.
name: Kerala Sahitya Academy Book Stall
address: Palace Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: Thrissur, a city in Kerala, has been facing issues with the poor condition of its buildings since the formation of the corporation in 2000. Efforts to address this have included discussions about providing concessions to construct new buildings by demolishing old ones and establishing a rehabilitation center during construction. The city's railway station is an important hub for Southern Railways, connecting it to major towns in Kerala and beyond.
name: Thrissur
address: R.S Road, Kokkala, Veliyannur, Thrissur, Kerala 68002, India

excerpt: Sprawling, casual restaurant with separate sections for Asian, Indian, Mediterranean & cafe cuisine.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Thrissur, Round The Global Diner is a spacious and casual restaurant with separate sections for Asian, Indian, Mediterranean and cafe cuisine. Offering delicious food at reasonable prices, the restaurant is popular with locals and visitors alike. The well-done classy interiors add to the appeal while good service ensures that you won't run out of tables. There's ample parking available too.
name: Round The Global Diner
address: Bus Stop, Daya Hospital, Thrissur - Shornur Rd, Peringavu, Thrissur, Kerala 680008, India

excerpt: Comfy, earth-toned venue with a patio crafting international roasts, burgers, pizza & stir-fries.
detail_description: ROASTOWN is a comfortable, earth-toned restaurant with a patio where you can enjoy international roasts, burgers, pizza and stir-fries. They also have table service.
name: ROASTOWN-Global Cuisine Restaurant
address: Aristo Road, Mission Quarters Rd, East Fort, Thrissur, Kerala 680005, India

excerpt: Paths lead to the top & bottom of this well-known, 80-foot tall waterfall, the largest in Kerala.
detail_description: Athirappilly Water Falls, also known as the Niagara of India, is a majestic 80-foot tall waterfall located in Kerala. It is situated at the border of Ernakulum district and Thrissur district and is a significant tourist attraction drawing visitors from all over during each season. The falls are best seen during the monsoon season when they are at their most substantial, offering breathtaking views from both the top and bottom.
name: Athirappilly Water Falls
address: Pariyaram, Kerala 680724, India

excerpt: Sandy beach with a kids’ play area, snack vendors & a paved walkway, renowned for its sunset views.
detail_description: Snehatheeram Beach, situated in Thrissur, is a must-visit destination known for its picturesque sandy shore and stunning sunset views. The beach offers a serene atmosphere with a paved walkway and a play area for kids. Its name, meaning "love shore," perfectly captures the harmonious blend of sun, sand, and the Arabian Sea. While weekends may bring crowds, visitors can still enjoy the calming sea tide and cool breeze as they witness breathtaking sunsets.
name: Snehatheeram
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Lush preserve with a variety of wildlife & picturesque landscape, including waterfalls & caverns.
detail_description: Kauthuka Park is a scenic and diverse nature reserve located 25 km away from the city center in Thrissur. It boasts of an abundance of wildlife, including birds, fish, and animals, as well as waterfalls and caves that provide picturesque views. This park is a tribute to human persistence evident in the amount of hard work put into its creation. Visitors can appreciate the stunning architecture and natural beauty it offers without being distracted by any individual's experience.
name: Kauthuka Park
address: 88RM+6FJ, P.O, Panampilly College Rd, Chalakkudy, Potta, Kerala 680722, India

excerpt: Low-key beach features a wide sandy expanse, tranquil, clear waters, a fish market & nearby temples.
detail_description: Chavakkad Beach in Kerala is a serene and unexplored destination with its wide sandy expanse, clear waters, and nearby temples. It's a popular spot for picnickers, honeymooners, and tourists alike. The beach offers stunning sunset views and activities like speed boating. While the beach provides ample parking and a kids' play area, there are opportunities for improvement in hygiene standards at nearby tea shops.
name: Chavakkad Beach
address: Kerala 680506, India

excerpt: Forest trails & riverside lookouts around a landmark waterfall known for its monsoon-season surges.
detail_description: Vazhachal Waterfalls is a stunning natural wonder located in Kerala, India. It is situated on the Chalakudy River and surrounded by a dense forest rich in biodiversity. The falls are known for their monsoon-season surges and are 80 feet in height and 330 feet in width, making them the largest in Kerala. The area offers forest trails, riverside lookouts, and a serene atmosphere that attracts nature lovers seeking a refreshing escape.
name: Vazhachal Waterfalls
address: 8H2V+H28, Athirappilly Rd, Pariyaram, Kerala 680724, India

excerpt: Traditional Hindu temple with carvings, statuary, multiple ponds & an elaborate annual festival.
detail_description: Sree Koodalmanikyam Temple, located in Irinjalakuda, Kerala, is a traditional Hindu temple known for its intricate carvings, statuary, and multiple ponds. It is an important stop on the Naalambalam Pilgrimage and holds immense cultural and historical significance. The temple's architecture showcases Kerala's rich heritage of traditional temple art with ornate carvings and an impressive entrance tower.
name: Sree Koodalmanikyam Temple
address: 86W2+JCH, The Administrator, Koodalmanikyam Devasom, Trissur District, Irinjalakuda, Kerala 680121, India

excerpt: Ancient temple devoted to multiple Hindu deities & featuring a palliyara (sleeping chamber).
detail_description: Nestled along the Kodungalloor-Eranakulam route, Thiruvanchikulam Mahadeva Temple stands as one of the oldest Hindu temples in existence, captivating visitors with its rich history and stunning architecture. This sacred site is dedicated to multiple deities and features a unique palliyara, or sleeping chamber. The serene atmosphere envelops you in tranquility, making it an ideal destination for spiritual seekers and families alike.
name: Thiruvanchikulam Mahadeva Temple
address: 6664+4GQ, Kodungallur- Ernakulam, Highway, Kottapuram, Kodungallur, Kerala 680664, India

excerpt: Dense forest, peaks & watershed areas in a huge nature reserve with viewpoints & trekking paths.
detail_description: Chimmini Wildlife Sanctuary is a vast nature reserve situated in Thrissur district, surrounded by dense forests, peaks and watershed areas. It covers an area of 85 square kilometers and forms part of a larger protected area along with the Peechi Vazhani wildlife sanctuary. The sanctuary features trekking paths and viewpoints that offer breathtaking views of the Western Ghats. Visitors can enjoy group cycling, forest trekking and turtle rides among other activities.
name: Chimmini Wildlife Sanctuary
address: CFJR+CC6, Chimmini Dam Road, Dist. Thrissur, Pariyaram, Kerala 680304, India

detail_description: Malakkapara View Point is a picturesque village known for its lush greenery and tranquil ambiance. Located about 110 km south of Thrissur, it offers stunning views that can be reached after a 50 km trek through the forest, where one can spot wildlife like elephants, deer, and monkeys. The area is eco-friendly and peaceful, with the sounds of birds being the only noise.
name: Malakkapara View Point
address: 7VH6+38H, 7VH6+WQJ, Valparai, Athirapil.li Rd, Malakkappara, Kerala 680724, India

excerpt: Multi-level falls over a rock face, with a swimming hole below, accessed by a short forest trek.
detail_description: Pattathippara Water Falls is a captivating natural wonder located in a wooded area. It boasts a cascading waterfall that descends over a rocky cliff, offering a multi-level spectacle. Accessible through both an adventurous forest trail and a regular entrance, this attraction provides various options for visitors. The forest trail presents challenging terrains suitable for off-road adventures, while the alternative entrance offers a more straightforward approach.
name: Pattathippara Water Falls
address: PO, Thalikode, Pattikkad, Pananchery, Kerala 680652, India

excerpt: Natural recreation area anchored by a large dam with viewpoints, picnic spots, & boating.
detail_description: The Peechi-Vazhani Wildlife Sanctuary in Thrissur is an exceptional nature retreat that offers a range of outdoor activities and opportunities to encounter diverse wildlife. This natural reserve features a major dam as its centerpiece, which provides stunning viewpoints, picnic areas, and boating options for visitors to enjoy. The sanctuary is particularly renowned for its rich biodiversity, housing over 25 species of mammals including tigers, leopards, and foxes.
name: Peechi -Vazhani Wildlife Sanctuary
address: FCMM+97V, Chimmini Dam Road, Pariyaram, Kerala 680304, India

excerpt: Large-scale water amusement park with wave pool, rafting, water chutes & rides.
detail_description: Dreamworld Water Park in Thrissur is a large-scale water amusement park offering a thrilling escape from the heat. With attractions like a wave pool, rafting, and water chutes, visitors can enjoy an exhilarating experience. The park's backdrop features one of Kerala's largest waterfalls, adding to its scenic charm. Visitors can also appreciate the polite staff and good food options while enjoying multiple rides without long queues. It's an ideal destination for families seeking fun and relaxation.
name: Dreamworld Water Park
address: Athirapilly Road, Kanjirappilly P.O, Thrissur, Chalakudy, Kerala 680721, India

detail_description: The Sree Parthasarathy Temple in Thrissur, specifically located in Olarikkara, is a picturesque and well-preserved Hindu temple. Its proximity to the Guruvayoor railway station makes it easily accessible for visitors. The temple exudes a peaceful and serene spiritual ambiance.
name: Olarikkara Parthasarathy Temple
address: G58M+HHW, Vatanappally - Kanjany - Thrissur Rd, Sakthan, Laloor, Thrissur, Kerala 680618, India

detail_description: The Peringottukara Devasthanam Sree Vishnumaya Kuttichathan Swami Temple is a well-maintained and beautifully lit Hindu temple. The arrangements for visitors are excellent, with tokens being issued in the morning and rituals starting at 12.30PM. For those who believe in 'graha-nakshatra-drishti', this temple is highly recommended. Upon entering the temple compound, one can experience a heavenly atmosphere adorned with numerous sculptures and paintings.
name: Peringottukara Devasthanam Sree Vishnumaya Swami Temple
address: Kanjany Peringottukara Rd, near Peringottukara Palace, Kizhakkummuri, Kerala 680571, India

detail_description: Vallachira Bhagavan Bhagavathi Temple is a pleasant and peaceful place with a positive atmosphere. The temple features a large pond in its vicinity, creating a serene ambiance. It is known as Kudumbakshetram and is adorned with natural elements that enhance its beauty. Inside the temple, there is a statue of Maha Vishnu, while outside, there is one of Bhagavathy.
name: Vallachira Bhagavan Bhagavathi Temple
address: Ambalanada Rd, Vallachira, Thrissur, Kerala 680562, India

detail_description: Located in Thrissur, Kerala, Vadakkechira is a historic pond that dates back to the reign of Shakthan Thampuran (1751-1805). This well-preserved landmark was initially constructed for irrigation and drinking purposes. Over time, it has undergone tasteful renovations and now boasts illuminated lights and a stunning fountain. Visitors can enjoy peddle boating with options available for both two and four people.
name: Vadakkechira
address: G6H8+W7J, Vadakke Stand, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

detail_description: Orappan Kettu Water Falls is a hidden gem in Thrissur district, offering a spectacular experience for visitors. The waterfall area is quite large, featuring 3-4 waterfalls and providing ample space to swim. Although it's located near the Institute and only takes a 15-minute walk to reach, the waterfall is not frequently visited due to its proximity. The surrounding forest area offers privacy and tranquility, making it an ideal spot for relaxation with friends or family.
name: Orappan Kettu Water Falls
address: Peechi Thrissur Pipeline Road, Companypadi - Manjakkunnu Rd, Pattikkad, Kerala 680652, India

detail_description: Cheruchakkichola Waterfalls & Check Dam is a hidden gem that offers an adventurous 20-30 minute trek to reach the top of the hill where the three-layered structure awaits. At the top, a small check dam provides a wide area for swimming, and the overflow creates a big waterfall just meters away. The second and third layers offer platforms to enjoy the cascading water. It's recommended to visit during or after monsoon season for an optimal experience.
name: Cheruchakkichola Waterfalls & Check Dam
address: P52X+3PF, Chittanda, Kerala 680585, India
